Deva (transl. God) is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Rosshan Andrrews (in his Hindi debut) and written by the duo Bobby–Sanjay. Produced by Roy Kapur Films and Zee Studios, the film stars Shahid Kapoor and Pooja Hegde.
The film was officially announced in May 2023. Principal photography began in October 2023 in Mumbai. The music is composed by Sachet–Parampara, while Jakes Bejoy provided the score. The cinematography is handled by Amit Roy and editing done by A. Sreekar Prasad.
Deva is scheduled to release on 11 October 2024, coinciding Dussehra.


Premise[edit]
The plot follows a brilliant yet rebellious police officer investigating a high-profile case. As he delves deeper into the case, he uncovers a web of deceit and betrayal, leading him down a thrilling and dangerous path.

Cast[edit]
Shahid Kapoor as Deva, a police officer
Pooja Hegde as Priyanka D’Souza, Deva’s love interest
Pavail Gulati as Scott, Deva’s sidekick[1]
Kubbra Sait as Emily, a waitress[2]
Production[edit]
Development[edit]
In early-August 2022, it was reported that Rosshan Andrrews visited Shahid Kapoor at his residence and narrated a script which impressed him.[3][4] Later, in November 2022, Rosshan Andrrews through his social media handles, confirmed that he would direct Shahid Kapoor in his upcoming film.[5] Touted to be an action thriller, the film marks the first collaboration between director Rosshan Andrews and Shahid Kapoor, and the first Hindi venture of Rosshan.[6]
The film is produced by Siddharth Roy Kapur's Roy Kapur Films and Zee Studios.[7] The company made a public announcement on 25 May 2023, confirming the project.[8] The film's official title Deva was revealed on 24 October 2023, on the occasion of Dussehra.[9] It marked the third collaboration of Shahid Kapoor with Siddharth Roy Kapur, after Kaminey (2009) and Haider (2014).[10] Shariq Patel of Zee Studios revealed that he had been in separate discussions with Siddharth and Shahid over the years about different projects.  Somehow they didn't materialise and it took this film to come together and this is the first time that the Zee Studios have collaborated with both director and actor.[10] Kapoor reduced his remuneration for the film and was reported to receive ₹25 crore (US$3.1 million) as actor's remuneration.[11]

Pre-production[edit]
Pre-production started on 16 November 2022.[12] It took several months for the writing and pre-production.[13] The film is scripted by the duo Bobby–Sanjay, in their ninth collaboration with Rosshan.[14] Sumit Arora, Hussain Dalal, Abbas Dalal and Arshad Syed wrote the Hindi dialogues for the film.[15][16] Later, Rosshan began location scouting for the film and shared a few pictures through his Instagram page.[17][18] Kapoor stated the film is an "edgy action thriller with lots of action and thrill".[19]
Sachet–Parampara would compose the songs, and background score by Jakes Bejoy. Technicians include cinematographer Amit Roy, editor A. Sreekar Prasad, art director Sandeep Ravade, stunt director Parvez Shaikh, costume designers Malavika Kashikar and Chandani Mehta. Insiya Burmawala and Aayush Phadnis of Roy Kapur Films have been appointed as executive producers of the film.[20] Prior to the start of film production, Kapoor attended a special workshop in October 2023, in order to train physically and intensively for his role in the film.[21]

Casting[edit]
Shahid Kapoor plays the role of a police officer in the film,[22] and would sport a short hairstyle for his character, similar to his look in Haider.[23] He said he is playing "a very hard character" in the film.[24] In May 2023, Pooja Hegde was reported to be the lead actress,[25] and her inclusion was confirmed by makers on 13 October 2023, on Hegde's birthday.[26] The makers wanted "a fresh casting" and finalised Hegde, marking her maiden collaboration with both Rosshan and Shahid.[27]
Kubbra Sait joined the cast in early-November 2023,[28] and would play a police officer.[29] The film marks her second collaboration with Kapoor, after web series Farzi.[2] For her character, she underwent intense training for tree months during the project's pre-production process, and also went through a workshop in Mumbai.[30] In late-November, Pavail Gulati joined the cast,[31] marking his first action film.[32] Gulati felt his role "demands physical and mental dedication".[33] For that he attended a special workshop in January 2024, in order to train physically and intensively for his role in the film.[34] For some challenging scenes that included hand-to-hand combat scenes featuring Gulati, for which Rosshan initially considered hiring a body double. But he insisted on doing them, as he felt that a body double's work would look inauthentic.[35]

Filming[edit]
Principal photography commenced with a muhurat shot  on 12 October 2023 with the film's cast and crew.[36] Shahid Kapoor, and Pooja Hegde joined in this schedule, in Mumbai.[37] Later in November, Kubbra Sait and Pavail Gulati joined this schedule.[38][39] The schedule was extensively shot at Dongri Charnul, Mumbai.[40] The first schedule was wrapped in Mumbai on 21 December 2023.[41] In late-February stills were revealed by the official social media handles for the film under the tagline #OnTheSetsOfDeva.[42]
The second schedule of the film was began in March 2024 in Mumbai, with Pavail Gulati joining the schedule.[43] Pooja Hegde joined the schedule on 14 March 2024.[44] On the next day, Shahid Kapoor joined the schedule on 15 March.[45] The Kapoor shot some action and chasing scenes in this schedule in Mumbai.[46] Gulati was trained with the stunt directors before filming a hand-to-hand combat sequence in Mumbai in late March.[47]

Music[edit]
The soundtrack album for Deva was composed by the duo Sachet–Parampara, in their first collaboration with director. Lyrics are written by Irshad Kamil. The original score was composed by Jakes Bejoy, in his third collaboration with the director. The music rights were bagged by Zee Music Company.[48]

Release[edit]
Theatrical[edit]
Deva is scheduled to release on 11 October 2024, coinciding Dussehra.[49]

Home media[edit]
The digital streaming rights were acquired by ZEE5 and the satellite rights by Zee Cinema.[50]
